main event: A bright, circular object was observed moving at high speed and making erratic maneuvers over Sioux City, Iowa on October 9, 1963.
interesting points: The object appeared to be approximately 50 feet in diameter and was observed to move at speeds estimated in excess of 1,000 mph.
The object moved in a northeasterly direction and was observed for approximately 15-20 seconds before simply vanishing from sight.
No sound, exhaust, or contrail was associated with the object, and it exhibited no flashing lights or other distinguishing features.
Multiple witnesses, including Mr. and Mrs. Robert Smith of Sioux City and Mr. and Mrs. John Doe of Sioux Falls, reported seeing the object.
The sighting took place on a clear night with good visibility, but the object could not be explained.
witnesses: Mr. and Mrs. Robert Smith, Mr. and Mrs. John Doe
